newsitem.title: UK: NWE high sulphur fuel oil stable, low sulphur easy.
newsitem.headline: NWE high sulphur fuel oil stable, low sulphur easy.

text.p: NWE high sulphur cracked fuel oil was notionally stable on Tuesday but market activity was extremely thin because of industry events in London, traders said.
High sulphur barges were traded in the morning at $96.50 fob ARA and bunker demand was assessed at around 15,000 tonnes. Low sulphur barges were steady, offered at $102 fob ARA.

High sulphur cargoes were steady. A trader was heard to have been bidding for a commitment into northern Ireland at around $98 cif NWE but other dealers assessed the market a couple of dollars lower than that.
Availability remains healthy, with stored product in ARA adding to usual supplies out of Scandinavia and the U.K.
Low sulphur fuel oil cargoes were steady to weaker in the absence of end user buying interest.
